narratives.question_text: How clearly did the instructor define the topic of study?
comments: The syllabus clearly identified all of the topics we were going to cover in the semester.
Very much enjoyed all of the topics discussed in the class

narratives.question_text: How clearly did the instructor outline the expectation for the course, classroom activity and homework?
comments: It was not always clear when things were due, which makes it hard to work towards a deadline.

The outline and expectations for the class were a bit blurry; due dates changed suddenly and without noticed, and there was a disconnect between the to teachers and who was teaching what when. There was one class that neither of the teachers prepared anything to do and made up a lesson somewhat on the spot and it was a bit frustrating and felt like a waste of time.

narratives.question_text: How well were individual class sessions prepared and presented?
comments: I really enjoyed the in class demos of the products we were talking about. It is one thing to just talk about them but to actually have a sample there and see it work was really helpful.
When a course has this much stuff that needs to be brought in weekly, you would think they would forget things or be late, that was not the case. They were always ready to go.
I felt Jen's lectures were better planned than Schrader's. Her materials were better prepared ahead of class.
I feel like there was a wide range of preparedness over the semester. I cant think of specifics right now but i am sure it directly correlates to how the Rep shows are going.
The lecture material was interesting, and the hands on work was fun
Both Jen and Schrader have extensive knowledge of the subjects they were lecturing and demonstrating on.

I think there should either be a longer, hands-on presentation of furniture repair or it should be rolled into a single class that includes stripping and staining. I dont feel like I got a lot out of the demonstrations.

narratives.question_text: How well did lectures fit within the boundaries of the course?
comments: Nothing toshow..
Projects were all very proportionally sized. If we decided that we wanted to go above and beyond then that was on us and not on the professors.
The project required outside work that could be very time consuming but both Jen and Schrader were very understanding and worked with us to come up with reasonably adjusted deadlines.
Being able to choose what we wanted to do for projects, such as picking an animal for the rattan project, allowed me to take on the workload I felt comfortable with.
I never felt overwhelmed with the workload, I think there were certain trial by choice elements to some of the projects, which was good for some of the more ambitious folks in the class.
The workload was appropriate for the nature of the class.

narratives.question_text: How available was the instructor for help outside the classroom?
comments: Both were delightful to speak to outside of class.
Both Jen and Schrader were very helpful both in and out of the classroom.
I never acquired about help outside the classroom personally.

narratives.question_text: How useful were assignments in furthering an understanding of the topic?
comments: We saw it, then we would do it. Simple System = Great System
I very much enjoyed the projects, they made the lecture material make sense outside of a vacuum.

I think the reed cane assignment should have stricter parameters. Since that technique seems mostly used for puppets, maybe it should be a puppetry assignment. It seemed like a pretty specific technique that would be limited to a specific need.

narratives.question_text: If tests were given, how fairly did they measure knowledge gained?
comments: There were no tests.

narratives.question_text: How useful was this course in preparing you for production work?
comments: I haven't needed it much for production work yet, but I can see using it in the future both in theatre and real life.
Haven't done props, I feel like i have more tools to work with now.
I am currently using material I learned in this class in my production assignment.
I have not used any knowledge gained in a production assignment yet.

narratives.question_text: How would you evaluate the instructor's knowledge of the material?
comments: Both Jen and Schrader were very knowledgeable, and accessible.

narratives.question_text: Please offer additional comments on such topics as: what worked best about the course, suggested improvements, class materials, etc.
comments: Make sure the trip to the art gallery furniture storage stays in the curriculum.

I think it would be a good idea to limit class size to six. Constantly competing for space and materials made the work frustrating a lot of the time and meant we got to cover fewer things in less depth. It seemed like a lot of class time was spent either wrestling with materials or waiting in line.
